sentence.Network_en: He just cited a farfetched illustration.

entry.tran: 穿凿附会的;不切实际的;牵强的
entry.def: If you describe a story or idea as far-fetched, you are criticizing it because you think it is unlikely to be true or practical.

example.ex: The storyline was too far-fetched and none of the actors was particularly good.
example.tran: 故事情节太离谱，演员表演也没有出彩的。

auth_sentence.content: This, too, is a very distorted and farfetched logic.
auth_sentence.res_content: This, too, is a very distorted and farfetched logic.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This, too, is a very distorted and farfetched logic.

auth_sentence.content: Perhaps farfetched, but I would be curious to see it investigated, or debunked.
auth_sentence.res_content: Perhaps farfetched, but I would be curious to see it investigated, or debunked.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Perhaps farfetched, but I would be curious to see it investigated, or debunked.

auth_sentence.content: But to pretend that the SM as such has been validated because bits of it have been proven is farfetched.
